title: How to Make Lemon Gin

steps.headline: Make the lemon juice by squeezing fresh lemons.
steps.description: Whether or not you include any of the pulp from the lemon is up to your own preferences.

steps.headline: Dissolve the sugar in the lemon juice.
steps.description: Pour the sugar and juice into a bowl. Stir to help dissolve it or place it on top of a heater temporarily. Do not heat over the stove top or this will cause the lemon juice and gin to separate once in the bottle.

steps.headline: Pour the gin into the sugar and lemon juice liquid.
Pour the gin mix into the prepared bottles.
Place the lemon gin bottles in a cool, dry and dark place to infuse.
steps.description: They need to sit for a minimum of 6 weeks before tasting them. After this time, check to see if the flavour is as you like it and if not, store longer.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: When it's ready for drinking, serve it with plenty of ice. It's also a good idea to refrigerate the bottle before serving, to give an added chill to the drink.

text: Make the lemon juice by squeezing fresh lemons. Whether or not you include any of the pulp from the lemon is up to your own preferences. Dissolve the sugar in the lemon juice. Pour the sugar and juice into a bowl. Stir to help dissolve it or place it on top of a heater temporarily. Do not heat over the stove top or this will cause the lemon juice and gin to separate once in the bottle. Pour the gin into the sugar and lemon juice liquid. Mix well. Pour the gin mix into the prepared bottles. Seal tight. Place the lemon gin bottles in a cool, dry and dark place to infuse. They need to sit for a minimum of 6 weeks before tasting them. After this time, check to see if the flavour is as you like it and if not, store longer. Serve. When it's ready for drinking, serve it with plenty of ice. It's also a good idea to refrigerate the bottle before serving, to give an added chill to the drink.
